result.execSummary:
The defendant Dakotah Lace Pagel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Escape-Criminal Arrest, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.42(3)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.dispoDesc: DE pleads Guilty to Ct #1.  Found Guilty.  Court orders PSI.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 10, 2017 at 03:30 pm.

records.addlTxt: modification conditions of probation - 30 days jail with huber effective 6/20/17

Defendant Dakotah Lace Pagel in court with attorney Heidi J. Mangelsen.  Defendant Dakotah Lace Pagel in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also has 15 CT 100 and 14 CF 46 (SEHR) -  Atty Mangelsen states jail credit was not accurate.  State argues sentencing.  Atty Mangelsen argues sentencing (356 days time served).  Defendant reads written stmt.  Oliver Fink (DE's stepfather) addressed the Court.  Court continues. 


Court:  14 CF 46 -  1 year county jail credit for 356 days time served and good time - costs to be converted to civil judgment if not paid

16 CF 57 -Prison for 2 years  and 3 years ES imposed/stayed
        Probation 3 years consecutive to sentence in 14 CF 46 - costs - any counseling DOC may impose - AODA and anger management assessment

15 CT 100 - Dismissed

Defendant Dakotah L. Pagel in court with attorney Heidi J. Mangelsen.  Defendant Dakotah L. Pagel in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both parties acknowledge receiving copies of the Pre-sentence investigation.  Atty Poquette makes correction: regarding page 4 / DE's prior record.  Court asks DE if she wishes to postpone today's hearing due to the fact that she did not personaly read the PSI document, DE states she does not wish to postpone.  Atty Poquette states concern, as does the court.  Court resets sentencing hearings to give DE time to view the PSI.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 13, 2017 at 01:00 pm.
from DOC Agent Houseman regarding PSI report - will have it filed no later than 10 days prior to the 01/10/17 SEH.

Defendant Dakotah Lace Pagel in court with attorney Heidi J. Mangelsen.  Defendant Dakotah Lace Pagel in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.  DE pleads Guilty to Ct #1.  Found Guilty.  Court orders PSI.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 10, 2017 at 03:30 pm.
Bond continues.

Defendant Dakotah Lace Pagel in court with attorney Heidi J. Mangelsen.  Defendant Dakotah Lace Pagel in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Donna Thompson Brussard sworn/testifies direct; cross;  court finds probable cause, bind over.  Arraignment scheduled for May 31, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Dakotah Lace Pagel in court via video with attorney Heidi J. Mangelsen.  Defendant Dakotah Lace Pagel in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint.   Atty Mangelsen does not waive time limits for preliminary exam.  Court advised defendant as to right to have prelim w/in 20 days does have time w/in 21 days.    $5000.00 s/b set. Defendant and atty agree to 21 days.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 26, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
